text: The gallery is beautiful. However, prices are very high and they only had coffee, no food.

resp.text: I'm glad you liked our Gallery.  We try to have a wide range of art,  ranging in price from $15 to $10,000.  Prior to COVID, we served fresh pastries.  When we re-opened after COVID, we weren't able to sell the pastries, so have temporarily stopped serving them.  We do have some snack items, but we never intended to be a restaurant--Just an art Gallery with an espresso bar.  Google had automatically labelled us as an "Art Cafe", and perhaps that has caused some confusion.  I have changed the Google Classification to more accurately reflect our offerings.  Thank you for your comments and we hope to see you again soon!

text: Great for date night. Instructors were very helpful and you will amaze yourself of what you can do. We went on Valentines and it was for Couples only. Had a great time! Would recommend this very highly.

name: Vickie Clemmons
text: My daughter paid $45.00 each for both of our projects 2/3 weeks prior to the class. When we arrived, we were told they did not have anyone signed up for that class. My daughter showed her email for payment conformation. The instructor said she would have to cut our pieces. It seemed a bother. We stood around for a while & she finally told us to sit with another class. I feel like we were not shown the attention as everyone else. We had to ask for paint, brushes, & water to clean the brushes. We are pretty crafty so we just looked at the sample and completed it on our own. We did not get holes drilled for the hanger...she could not work the drill and the piece was not sealed. I do not recommend this business. Everyone should be treated with the same attention.....very disappointed!!

name: Nameless Faceless
text:
My mom, niece, and I had a pretty abysmal experience here.
It was our third time doing a sip and paint class (I don't even want to call it a class at this point). There was little to no direction by the "instructor" who made it VERY clear that she was not supposed to be there that late and informed us that the girl who was supposed to teach the class couldn't make it.
Like many other establishments like this, they offer a variety of painting classes at different levels of difficulty. You also have the option to "upgrade" your painting by purchasing a larger canvas.
Another thing that most of these places do is sell the paintings that the instructors do during every class. I wish I could say that they're affordable and worth the price, but that definitely is not the case. When I inquired about which paintings were for sale and about the general cost, the woman got snarky with me. After paying well over $100 to for little to no instruction and having an overall bland experience, I did not want to give this place any more of my money.
PAINTER'S TIP:
I would suggest stopping by Walmart (or ordering off Amazon) and getting a cheap variety pack of paintbrushes (I posted a photo of the pack I purchased). I found that the brushes they supplied were a little worn out and often I couldn't get my lines as thin as I wanted them (I have a heavy hand).

name: Brandi Paustian
text: We love The Broken Brush! Jessica is a great teacher and it is always so much fun. My 12 year old son loves it too.

name: Sipping Tea
text: I just can't even with this place

name: Sara Crocker
text: This was the cutest shop! It's filled with art from local Alabama artists. Paintings, jewelry, decor, ornaments all great gift options. The owner was very sweet and personable. I'm excited to go back when I have more time to browse!

name: Tri Burban
text: Great place selling art, accessories and other items made by local artists. The owner is a beautiful soul who really cares about her craft, both as a proprietor and as one of the artists. I truly enjoyed my time in the store and wish them all success. Only reason for less than 5 stars is the lack of representation of the demographic of Montgomery. In a city that's majority African-American, I would live to see more artists of color.

name: Jeremy Lewis
text: Fun and quirky store of local arts and crafts, along busy Madison Ave commuter road, so parking on street requires care during rush hour. The paintings on the walls are by local primitives, with bright colors and two dimensions. There are examples of costume jewelry and pottery, likewise in the folk art genre. (This ain't SCAD or RISD). The treasure I found is a children's book written, drawn and produced by Tom Spencer, "Riley, Ace of Spies" with delightful illustrations by the author. In the best tradition, the text is as amusing on an adult level as for children.

name: Cresta Christensen
text: Such an awesome experience! My daughter and I went here for the first time yesterday and had a great time! Josh is a very patient, knowledgeable and friendly instructor. Very creative, organized atmosphere. We are already planning our next trip! Also... CALL THE STUDIO BEFORE YOU PURCHASE A GROUPON! Josh will honor that price without you having to purchase over Groupon, but he doesn’t lose a large percentage of the commission. So if you plan on going, just call the studio first! And you should DEFINITELY plan on going!

resp.text: Cresta it was a blast having you in the store. You and your daughter both did some really cool stuff. Hope to see you again soon!

text: I really enjoyed the variety of designs and the unique challenges of designing glass pieces. A new and welcome experience!

name: Denise Tevis
text: Josh and Lana are knowledgeable, helpful, and so friendly. They have a nice selection of tools and glass, including a discount glass section. My partner and I drove from Altanta to Dallas to buy glass for our stained glass projects. The owners answered all our questions and offered helpful tips and suggestions. We found everything we needed. Worth the drive—would definitely come here again!

resp.text: Denise so glad you stopped by and visited us at the store. Thank you so much for allowing us to serve you and your glass needs!

name: Abby Barton (abbyheartsbooks)
text: I have ZERO artistic talent and went into the class with no idea of what I wanted to do. Josh and his wife were AMAZING at easing my nerves and showing me how I can create a beautiful bowl regardless of my lack of talent. I went with friends (all of our first time there) and we had THE BEST TIME learning how to cut and shape glass. Josh was very good at explaining everything we needed to know. All my friends and myself agreed that we will keep going back to make more pieces. I HIGHLY recommend this class for mental/emotional therapy, date nights, friends bonding time, and any other reason you can come up with!

resp.text:
Abby...
Thank you so very much for giving me the opportunity to serve you and yours! It makes me extremely happy to know you had a great experience. As you have already been back to the store shows how much you enjoyed the process. Again thank you, will call soon to let you know your second piece is ready to pickup!

text: Fantastic experience!! Me & my best friend were wanting a fun new adventure.. a new thing to try.. a new creative outlet and this didn’t disappoint! We thoroughly enjoyed our evening, Josh and his wife were super helpful, so easy going & fun to be around, and all around wonderful!! Josh helped me make a bird for my piece and it was exactly what I wanted! They’re there to help but easily stand aside and let you and your creativity do your thing! ♥️♥️ I cant wait to go back and get our other bestie in on the fun!! I cannot wait to get my finished piece now!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for coming, so glad you had a great time! Can not wait to see you and all of your besties! See you soon!

resp.text: Belinda...I am so glad that you, Jana and your daughter had a good time. Hope to see you again soon!

This PLACE IS AWESOME. My woman and I went on an Saturday morning in November. I was very apprehensive at first but ended the day loving my experience.

I made an Cigar ashtray and four coasters. Josh was very easy to undaunted and his glass cutting & breaking demonstrations will give you all the confidence you need to make an great piece of glass art.

resp.text: So happy you had a good time! Looking forward to seeing you again soon! I know Piece of Heaven Bakery next door will love seeing you Again as well! Tell Danielle to email me to confirm date and number of people coming next time!

name: Hannah Hutcherson
text: Josh and his wife were so amazing! Our first experience with infused glass and his guidance was great! You can tell them love for what they do definitely shows!! I win definitely be back 😊

resp.text: Hannah thank you so much I am glad you had a great time. Your pieces turned out great am sure you will be very pleased!

name: Jill Snelling
text: After months of search found Guidance Glass and now want to stand of the roof top and tell everyone!  I had purchased a gorgeous fixer upper corner cabinet with carved wood curved front and curved doors made of leaded glass.  Little did I know the difficulty of finding someone to replace broken panes!  Then I met Josh...he is the owner of the company and he changed everything.  He created beautiful curved pieces, took apart and replaced all the lead between the glass and then reinstalled it back onto the doors.  He even gave me choices if i wanted to update a color on certain sections.  He had great attention to detail, took his time to get it done the right way and was worth every penny.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

resp.text: Jill thank you for your kind words. I greatly appreciate you took the time to leave the review. The cabinet doors did look good once reinstalled. Thank you for giving me the opportunity to serve you! If I can be of any assistance in the future please let me know!

name: John Rowe
text:
Only going by previous ratings however, I am sooooooo excited to have stained glass back in this area.  I took lessons years ago on 92 in Hiram.  I love doing stained glass, while I  think I'm pretty good(MADE A PIECE with 207 pieces, my wife helped) I have so much to learn.  I'll be taking classes soon and I'll get back.
So far a 5 star just for being in Paulding County  - let's all help support this brave artist - talk about stained glass to everyone and especially Guidance Glass!!!!!!!!!

resp.text: John please make sure to come see me soon. As a school teacher we are only open Friday evenings, Saturday, and Sunday. I will work hard to outdo your expectations.

name: NY Grl
text: Josh is trying hard to give the art glass community what it wants and needs: a wide selection of glass and help from someone who knows and understands the glass artist. I hope his business expands and grows as the glass community finds out about him. Let's support this local business that's working hard to support us!

text: Our daughter selected Venue 3131 for her wedding and reception. From setting the date in June 2020 through the wedding day 6/26/21 the staff has been responsive and helpful. They enjoy what they do and do it well. The setting is lovely and versatile. The chapel is air conditioned. The studio opens up, and strategically placed fans kept us comfortable as the sun went down. They give access to a room full of decorations. Daughter opted to leave some of hers, so the staff handled take down for us. Rehearsal dinner set up was in the arbor terrace that was quite pleasant. Chris and Holly and crew are excellent! I have attended some other events there that were well done also.

Hi Teri, thanks for posting some photos from your daughters wedding.  We were fortunate to be able to work with her and Tyler and this wedding was so fun and unique!  WE LOVED IT!

We are thankful that we have very responsive, and accommodating staff that always go above and beyond. We hope to see you again at more events in the future!

name: Brian Reaves
text: This is an incredibly beautiful venue capable of just about any wedding scenario. Their outdoor area is like something out of a movie with the vines covering it, and their indoor area is spacious and clean. They even have the perfect spot for the reception right there on the grounds with rolling doors to allow for indoor or outdoor receptions. The owners are incredibly nice people who really want to make the event special.

name: Tammy Willis
text: What an awesome company.  I received one of their bouquets as a gift from my son who lives in Huntsville.  When I visited him this past June, I wanted to go to their store and arrange another bouquet for my home and have it shipped.  They were so friendly, helpful and talented in helping me arrange the perfect bouquet and having it shipped to my home in California.  Upon my return home, I received my package and unfortunately, the Post Office was a little rough with my package and damaged some of the flowers.  Anthony at Paper Petals assured me they would take care of me and that they did!  They replaced the damaged flowers in a very timely manner with great communication throughout the process.  Awesome customer service and I will not hesitate to use them again.  Their flowers are incredible, life like and beautiful.  Best part, I don't have to water or worry about dying.  Thank you!

resp.text: Hi Tammy, we're so glad you had a good experience with us (and that your replacement bouquet arrived safely!) It was great having you visit our studio and we really enjoyed arranging your bouquet together for you!

name: G Dunn
text: Beautiful flowers in store. I took a class to make cherry blossoms. Thao was a great teacher and very patient with us all. Everyone made beautiful flowers! LOVE

resp.text: Thank you for attending the class! It was so fun working with everyone. And we agree, everyone's flowers turned out lovely!

name: Mary Hinson
text: I went to Paper Petals Co at Lowe Mill and picked up and Zinnia Kit along with a cute vase! The kit came with all the materials needed and a code to the video tutorial. All you need are a pair of scissors! My family had such a fun time making these flowers and we were so happy with how they all came out!

resp.text: The flower you created looks gorgeous, Mary! Thank you to you and your family for giving our Craft Box a try!

name: Anastacia LaRocco
text: I don't even know where to begin when it comes to singing their praise. They are amazing when it comes to communication and they go above and beyond for their customers. I left a resin flower in their care that my father had made before he passed and I have been so nervous but they treated it with great care. Because of them my dad still gets to walk me down the aisle and I couldn't ask for more. They more than delivered on my wedding flowers and I'm so grateful they will forever be a part of my special day. Thank you so SO much!

resp.text: Staci, we absolutely loved working with you and your family! And seeing everyone's reaction to all of our flowers, especially the incorporation of your father's resin flower, made the occasion even more special. Thank you for choosing us to create such a sentimental piece for your special day!

I have followed Paper Petals Co. on social media for a couple of years now and have always wanted to order because their work is just so beautiful. I finally ordered two different items for Mother’s Day and WOW they did not disappoint! Absolutely stunning and detailed work! I am so happy with both bouquets. 10/10 Recommend!!

Also, the packing for the shipping was perfect and so well done! No concern about damage at all!

Everything I expected and more!!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing our flowers for Mother's Day, Ashleigh! We're happy that you're happy with our flowers! We hope you and your loved ones will enjoy those flowers for years to come.

text: We are in love with Thao's amazing work! My husband surprised me for our anniversary with a paper version of my flower crown from our wedding, and with the most adorable cherry blossoms for my birthday. We also sent a Mother's day bouquet that was absolutely gorgeous. I cannot say enough good things, and now want to fill my entire house with these gorgeous creations!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Bridget! We loved recreating your flower crown and the rest of your florals so we're so happy to hear they were well received!

name: Delilah Steen
text: I love the craft boxes. The single stem and bouquets are also really great for presents. Shipping is fast and beautifully packaged.

name: Shalin Mody
text: They have the most wonderfully crafted paper flower bouquets 🤩🌺😍! I've received compliment after complement for the paper flowers I've sent friends and loved ones.  Even better is the story behind the business.  We're very fortunate to have them in Huntsville 😁

resp.text: Thank you for your appreciation for our flowers, Shalin!! It was really a pleasure to chat with you when you stopped by the studio!

name: Ashim Shrestha
text: Absolutely beautiful flowers, with top-notch craftsmanship! Brilliant choices, and selections to chose from. I used them for my niece's birthday party theme, and she loved it so much that she ended up using them in her room. Thao was so easy to work with and made sure she knew exactly what I wanted. Couldn’t be happier, highly recommend!!

resp.text: This really means a lot that she continued to use them in her room after the party! Thank you for letting us be a part of her special day!

name: conbuom
text: This place is everything! The craftsmanship, attention to detail, it’s all gorgeous. And all of the interactions with them were super professional and friendly. Plus the owners have built this business organically - from the ground up! Which is another reason I love to support them. Highly recommend.

resp.text: We are so happy reading your review conbuom, thank you so much for your praise! We feel blessed to have your support, so thank you for following along with us on our paper flower journey!

name: Mika Middleton
text: all around amazing work and excellent customer care. I will be purchasing from them again and again.

resp.text: Thank you, Mika! We always look forward to when you stop by the studio!

name: M Dohr
text:
Coolest bouquet I’ve ever bought for  my gal.

She loved it and it will last .. timeless

resp.text: Thank you for choosing our flowers!!

name: Mariah Johnson

The best part is we still have them for memories and decorations in our home. Thao was wonderful to work with. She listened to my vision and made it come to life. I would nightly recommend her flowers to anyone for any occasion! Well worth the money.

resp.text: Mariah, it was such a pleasure working with you to create your bridal bouquet!! For our flowers to be a part of your special day and knowing that they are still brightening up your home, that makes our day. Thank you so much for trusting us with your wedding flowers!

name: Ishan B

name: Kathleen N
text: During this strange chaotic time, I was looking for something to spark a sense of joy. I started in my venture of wanting to grow flowers/plants, but knowing I have a black thumb. As a result, I started looking into paper flowers. Instagram recommended Paper Petals Co. after some search, and I began reading up on the company’s mission statement. I will be honest and say, I also have a very soft spot for Asian women entrepreneurs who are thriving in their businesses. I am so excited to eventually get many more flowers, but I did send a bouquet to a friend and can’t wait to see my friend’s reaction. With that said, I am incredibly impressed by Thao’s talent, her passion for her work, and her kindness as a human. It’s been such a pleasure conversing with her, and I plan to continue supporting this business that brings so much happiness.

resp.text: Reading your words of kindness and encouragement have truly made our days, Kathleen! Thank you so much for all of the support you've given us and we cannot wait for you to one day visit our studio!

name: Mariah Zielke
text: Thao’s flowers are so beautiful! The perfect dainty addition to my home.

resp.text: Thank you, Mariah!! We're happy that our flowers can be decorating your home!

name: Emaley Thomas
text:
I'd met the owner of this shop at an event & fell in love with her work. When I was walking through Lowe Mill one day I saw that she had opened up shop recently via her social media and I will forever be buying flowers from her.
The quality of work is unlike anything I've seen in paper flowers. You can tell not only by talking to her but by her attention to detail she is doing what she loves. The flowers are vibran, well-constructed,  and one of a kind. Will always come back to buy more.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your compliments, Emaley!! It is so good to hear that the little details are not going unnoticed, so thank you for your love for our flowers!

name: Priscillia Engelking

I placed my order on Saturday and it was delivered Sunday. I cried, it’s honestly that exquisite, and such a welcome distraction from all that’s going on in our world today. I don’t have a creative bone in my body, but it’s been a lovely activity. Thank you so much, Thao!!

name: Barb Higgins
text: No respect for the safety of their customers

resp.text:
Hi Barb,

First and foremost, we value the safety of all of our customers. We offered anyone who contacted us an alternative to complete the workshop on December 10th. We made it very clear when you called that we completely understood not wanting to get out in the weather and you could pick your project up at a later date to make at home. You made the choice to come to the workshop anyway. To write a review that says we have no respect for the safety of our customers with zero context into the situation is both misleading and inaccurate, since the weather was apparently not bad enough for you to stay home.

Thank you for your feedback.
H&S Huntsville

name: Kippen Gallagher
text: Stacy is a wonderful artist potter. She is constantly evolving with her designs and her glaze work. She's a fascinating artist. Her work is a pleasure to have in my home and being used on a daily basis. From plates for my grandchild years ago to more recent mugs.

resp.text: Kipper, I appreciate that so much. Thank you. It’s been a pleasure getting to know you

name: Kitten Kaos
text:
I have taken two classes with Stacy at the Mill over this summer.

The Octopus class was incredibly detailed and amazingly cool. Nothing held back; Stacy is invested in her students having as much success as possible in the process. She was accommodating to my flight schedule and carry-on restrictions and worked with me on the things I could not bring on the plane. The class was fun and I got to meet and make new friends with a great bunch of clay folk. And, I made a crazy octopus bowl to boot!

Later in the summer, I was able to take another class, Slip Trailing, on my way to a work seminar. This was a tremendous compliment to the octopus work, and will have applications in a lot of my other work. It adds a dimension (literally) that is not available through glaze or underglaze. She was detailed enough in the chemistry that I was hooked, but not so much that the class was lost. The demos and slip play go a super long way in understanding the intricasies of the process.

Now to the area. Alabama is just lovely! The hot sticky weather that they were having was perfect for my cold northern blood. The flora in Alabama is completely different to mine, and I enjoyed driving around to take it all in. The Mills are an amazing space dedicated to the arts and I could have spent days wandering the booths. And!! Anyone visiting Stacy who is gluten free or paleo; I found the most delightful bakery and eatery. Their dedicated gluten free facility has some of the best stuff, and that includes BEFORE my diagnosis. Try the jalapeno cheddar scones at Mason Dixon Bakery, you’ll never want to leave.

So seriously, if the opportunity comes to have class with Stacy and S.P.Morgan Studios, take it; you will have no regrets.

name: Betsy
text: I have purchased several pieces from Stacy Morgan and every piece is as beautiful and well crafted as the last. The glazes and her techniques make each piece truly special whether it is functional like a great noodle bowl or decorative. Stacy responds quickly and is very helpful. I will keep ordering more.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Betsy! I appreciate your kind words and your support.

name: Kathryn Somers
text: I have taken 2 workshops from Stacy.  She is a wonderful instructor who is able to communicate and demonstrate effectively to her classes.   She is funny, passionate, curious and caring, thoughtful and a fountain of knowledge.   The facility at Lowe Mill in Huntsville is fantastic and her studio there is an artist's dream - open and full of light.    Her work is fully of whimsy and charm and is always flawless in its execution.   I am delighted to have a piece of her work and it makes me smile whenever I walk by it.

resp.text: Thanks, Kathryn! I hope we get to reconnect soon.

name: Cheryl Krebs
text: An incredibly talented potter with a ♡ of gold. I own a few of Stacy’s pieces and enjoy them even more each day. They are durable and SO FUN! I am also a potter so I have pretty high standards for skill and aesthetics... her pieces exceed the quality of most potters and the aesthetics speak for themselves. If you get a chance to meet Stacy... do it... then when you drink from one of her vessels you can think of her and enjoy the moment even more.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Cheryl. I learned by being a part of our community. <3

name: Daniela Perallon
text: I'm so picky about pottery, but Stacy's work is incredibly unique, hitting all the notes from moody and dark to bright and whimsical and everywhere in-between. She's always experimenting with new designs and techniques while maintaining top notch quality. I'm proud to own her artwork! We are running out of room on our mug shelf because we can't stop purchasing her mugs.

name: Kiley Salmon
text: I love every piece that I have from here. They are each so unique and beautiful. If you are like me and love the feel of textures on your hands you will love her work. I don't think that I truly ever appreciated the work that goes in to someone making coffee cups and vases but after touching my first cup and following her page I am always in awe of the things that she can make.

resp.text: Thank you! I appreciate the support.

text: Her work is simply mesmerizing, the glaze work is the coolest I've ever seen. I had to get a purple squid mug and it's one of my absolute favorites.  Almost too pretty to use. I've gotten so many compliments on it and considering I've used it at least twice a week since last June, I think it's holding up well for hand made pottery. I look forward to expanding my collection.

text: Stacy Morgan is not only a talented artist, but an excellent business owner who communicates well and is extremely accommodating. I had several questions that she answered quickly, and she shipped my purchase quickly. Upon arrival, I was amazed to find the item I had purchased (one of her awesome frog mugs) was even more beautiful in person. The design is excellent too, as the handle is sooo comfy in my hand! I give SP Morgan Studio my highest recommendation!

She also has an online shop that is Mobile optimized 💛

name: Lisa Andrew
text: I have been an admirer of Stacy Morgan's beautiful unique pottery for a while, so I jumped on the chance to take one of her workshops.  What a fun, outstanding learning experience.  Stacy is not only a talented artist, but also a skilled communicator and teacher.  I enthusiasically recommend her workshops.  When I can't make it to her studio in person, I keep an eye on her website and jump at the chance to add another piece to my collection.

text: Stacy is one of the most creative people I know. After falling in love with her techniques at creating her octopus pieces I decided to make the long trek from Texas to her studio at Lowe Mill in Huntsville, Alabama. Not only did I learn all about how to make pieces with her techniques we also quickly became friends. Her easy manner and southern hospitality were endearing and welcoming. We planned a second trip out with the original group we had but were very disappointed to have to reschedule due to Covid-19. It’s been the highlight of my year to return and take more classes with Stacy.

resp.text: Thank you, Laura. I am holding high hopes we get to have our reunion this fall and I am so looking forward to seeing you all again.

I would recommend getting your hands on some of it as soon (and as often) as possible.

So I have dedicated my right forearm in honor of my family and heritage. I will definitely be going back to have all my work done through Skin Deep because they have such amazingly talented artist there, and I have a few more piercings I’m getting which I will also have done there. So if you are looking for a talented tattoo artist and a shop that makes you feel welcomed, I highly recommend Skin Deep!

name: Jay Johnson
text: the man that did my tattoos was very nice but the tattoos turned out HORRIBLY.. they just turned into open scabs and one of them formed a water bubble as if it were a burn. I went back to show them the tattoo and the first thing that was asked was “did you get it here” .... KNOWING that they had JUST seen me.!! Then I was directed to another artist there who DID NOT do my tattoos and wasn’t even there the day i had got them and he clearly knew that something wasn’t right because he asked “what have you put on it.?!?” And I replied “aquaphor” because that’s what they recommended and that’s also what I used for my other previous tattoos. And then he tried to get smart saying how long he’s been in “the chair” and they couldn’t do anything until it “healed” But the thing is when this heals they wouldn’t be able to put ink on the spots that are MISSING SKIN and they KNOW IT. I was extremely polite until they tried to pass it off like they didn’t see my skin and the colored FLESH that was showing because the artist dug wayyy too deep. I was even okay with the artist not making the tattoo the color i wanted because he claimed he “couldn’t see well” that night so i went with a whole nother tattoo look than i was going for.& I thought it still turned out nicely until things took a turn for the worst.  I know how tattoos are supposed to heal because I have them and have went to MULTIPLE ARTISTS so It’s not me being “picky” or rude . I at least wanted them to be more concerned but I couldn’t get an apology, an offer to make things right, or even my money back. But I have contacted my lawyer and I will have to make the necessary steps.!! Like I said the man who did the tatt was  NICE as ever but he dug too deep and it left permanent damage on both tats and it could’ve went differently had they at least acknowledged what was wrong. Truly sad the way things were handled/not handled.!! No one wants to have messed up skin especially in a place where it’s visible to people. I trusted them with my skin and the art but got done horribly.. this is why I believe with some places you need to just pay half or pay after the work is done and even if you pay before hand, if something goes wrong because of THEM and you go to them in a polite manner even though this is your body so you have a reason to be alarm and HEATED ....then they should at least do everything in their power to make it right and pay you back and try to fix it. But like I said there’s no fixing this and they knew it that’s why I had to take legal action. Not trying to bash their business or anything because my first initial thought was “they’re pretty nice people and it’s a cool space” when i first walked in to set the appointment but as far as my experience and things .... I definitely won’t be going there again and the way they handled my situation.. I highly wouldn’t recommend and that’s just me.!!
